p: The role of low temperature in dormancy cycling is often discussed in terms of its signal value. However, both photosynthesis and phloem transport are sensitive to low temperatures [ 1, 53], which are likely to diminish the development of growing buds. Therefore, producing TBs before temperatures drop seems a superior strategy, as it allows diversion of photosynthates from growing points to buds and other reserve stores well before cold halts photosynthesis, induces leaf abscission, and renders sieve tubes in the shoot dysfunctional [ 54, 55].
